intro: Platystele caudatisepala, commonly known as the caudate-sepaled platystele, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. This epiphytic plant is characterized by its short, compact rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves that form a water-holding cup. It produces small, white to pale green flowers that are typically clustered in a spike, and it is adapted to grow on trees in humid, shaded environments. The plant's unique botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements.
